message.content: This question requires some knowledge about the concept of recycling. Recycling is the process of converting waste materials into reusable materials. Option (D) is the correct answer because it describes the process of turning old Pepsi bottles (a waste material) into t-shirts (a reusable material). Option (A) is incorrect because coal being turned into heat energy is not an example of recycling. Option (B) is incorrect because the use of fossil fuels by cars does not involve recycling. Option (C) is incorrect because turning Styrofoam plates into trash is not recycling, as trash is typically not reused or turned into a new material.

This question tests knowledge about the process of recycling. Recycling occurs when materials, such as old Pepsi bottles, are transformed into new products, like t-shirts. Option (A) is incorrect because coal being turned into heat energy is not a recycling process. Option (B) is incorrect because the use of fossil fuels by cars is not related to recycling. Option (C) is incorrect because Styrofoam plates being turned into trash is not a recycling process but rather the end result of improper waste disposal.

This question requires knowledge about the process of recycling. Recycling occurs when old materials are transformed into new products. In this case, when old Pepsi bottles are recycled, they can be turned into new products such as t-shirts. Option (A) is incorrect because the process described is not recycling, but rather the conversion of one form of energy to another. Option (B) is incorrect because it describes the use of fossil fuels, not recycling. Option (C) is incorrect because the process described is not recycling, but rather the disposal of Styrofoam plates as trash.

Option (B) is incorrect because the use of fossil fuels by cars is not directly related to recycling. Option (C) is incorrect because Styrofoam plates being turned into trash is not a process of recycling, but rather a disposal of waste.
